chapter.title: Logging
chapter.para: This chapter briefly describes server logging. For audit information, see the chapter on Audit Logging.
OpenIDM uses Simple Logging Facade for Java to log server messages. You can configure logging by editing the conf/logging.properties file where you installed OpenIDM.

The default configuration writes log messages in simple format to logs/openidm*.log files where you installed OpenIDM, rotating files when the size reaches 5 MB, and retaining up to 5 files. Also by default, OpenIDM writes all system and custom log messages to the files.
You can update the configuration to attach loggers to individual packages, setting the log level to using the following values.
chapter.programlisting: SEVERE (highest value) WARNING INFO CONFIG FINE FINER FINEST (lowest value)
